abstract.para: Follow these steps to create a key pair when you integrate &EMR; with &DDBlong;.

section.title: Step 1: Create a Key Pair
section.para: To run Hive interactively to manage data in &DDB;, you will need a key pair to connect to the &EC2; instances launched by &EMR; (&EMR;). You will use this key pair to connect to the master node of the &EMR; job flow to run a HiveQL script (a language similar to SQL).

step.para: Sign in to the &console; and open the &EC2; console at &url-console-domain;ec2/.
In the upper right hand corner of the console, select a Region from the Region drop-down menu. This should be the same region that your &DDB; database is in.
Click Key Pairs in the Navigation pane.
The console displays a list of key pairs associated with your account.
Enter a name for the key pair, such as mykeypair, for the new key pair in the Key Pair Name field and click Create.

Download the private key file. The file name will end with .pem, (such as mykeypair.pem). Keep this private key file in a safe place. You will need it to access any instances that you launch with this key pair.

important.para: If you lose the key pair, you cannot connect to your &EC2; instances.

step.para: For more information about key pairs, see &EC2long; Key Pairs in the &guide-ec2-user;.
